intro: Cylindrokelupha chevalieri, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its large, white, fragrant flowers that open at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators. The plant has heart-shaped, velvety leaves and produces small, round fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil. Due to its unique blooming habit and ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
